revised_title: William Buckland's Geological Lecture and the Discovery of the Paviland Cave Skeleton
tldr: This article discusses a geological lecture given by William Buckland at Oxford University in 1823, where he announced the discovery of a human skeleton with artifacts in the Paviland Cave in Wales. The lecture was attended by senior members of the university, showing their interest in the new field of geology despite religious opposition. Buckland's work in geology and paleontology helped reconcile scientific findings with religious beliefs, and his research on the Mosaic deluge contributed to the understanding of diluvial deposits and antediluvial fauna.
